item.text: What is your gender identity? (Choose all that apply).
How would you describe your sexual orientation?
How frequently do you use a computer (choose one)?
What training or experience with computers have you had? (check all that apply)

answerOption.valueString: Formal course(s) in computer science or related field
Formal medical school training in computers
Formal residency or fellowship training in computers
Formal workshops or conferences on computers for which I received CME credit
Workshops or conferences on computers for which I did not receive CME credit

item.text: On the whole, how sophisticated a computer user do you consider yourself? (choose only one)
On the whole, how interested are you in learning more about computers? (choose only one)

answerOption.valueString: I’ll learn more it I have to, to do my job
I’d just as soon avoid the subject.
I feel hostile when I hear the word “computer”.

item.text: On the whole, how interested are you in learning more about the noncomputer aspects of medical informatics (e.g. evidence based medicine, Problem oriented medical record, etc.) (choose only one)

answerOption.valueString: I’ll learn more it I have to, to do my job
I’d just as soon avoid the subject.
I feel hostile when I hear the words “medical informatics”

item.text: To what extent do you personally use a computer for each of the following professional tasks? Please circle your answer.
Documenting patient information (e.g., history & physicals, progress notes)
Accessing clinical data (e.g., laboratory data, EKGs, radiology reports)
Obtaining advice on a specific patient's diagnosis or therapy
Writing (e.g., grants, research papers, teaching material)
Performing statistical analysis on clinical or research data
Internet search and research on topic
Below are descriptions of general data management tasks. For each, please indicate: the relevance of this task to your work and your current level of knowledge or expertise with this task
Capture and create metadata (descriptive information about your data, how it was collected, and other contextualizing information)
Use common data elements, ontologies (formal models of concepts within a domain and their relationships), or other predefined terms for describing your data or variables
Organize, tag, and track data so multiple team members can work on the same dataset
Conduct research through data mining (using computational methods to discover patterns in large datasets)
Locate and obtain other researchers’ shared data to use in your research, and clean or process it to meet your research needs
Demonstrate, analyze, or communicate your research results through data visualization
Create a plan for long-term storage and retention of your data
Publish and deposit data in a repository suited to your research field
Write a formal data management plan, including selecting file formats, choosing a standard for data description, and planning for storage and preservation
Please answer the following questions about your data management and sharing practices.
Have you ever had any formal training in data management?
Do you currently use any NIH-sponsored (such as LiveLink) or commercial programs (such as Excel) for managing your data?

answerOption.valueString: Yes, I use both NIH-sponsored and commercial programs

item.text: If yes, please list the programs you use.
Have you ever uploaded your data to a public repository?
If yes, please list the repository or repositories to which you have uploaded data.
Have you ever shared data with another researcher, either informally or through a formal agreement, such as a material transfer agreement or data sharing agreement?
You have indicated that you have never shared your data nor uploaded to a repository. Please indicate the reason(s) for not sharing your data. Please check all that apply.

answerOption.valueString: I would be willing to share my data, but I haven’t had an opportunity to do so
My data contain personally identifiable information and sharing would compromise my subjects’ privacy
I am prohibited from sharing my data for some reason other than subject privacy
I don’t know any repositories that accept the kind of data I produce
It’s too difficult to prepare my data and documentation for sharing with others
I don’t know how to prepare my data and documentation for sharing with others
Repositories’ requirements for format or description of data are too difficult to meet
I don’t feel I would get credit for sharing my data
I put in a great deal of time and effort to gather my data, and I don’t want to give it away
I’m concerned that another researcher could beat me to publication if I share my data
My data has commercial value, so I don’t want to give it away for free
I don’t think anyone else would have any reason to use my data
It isn’t customary to share data in my research field
I’m concerned another researcher might find errors in my data
I’m concerned another researcher might misinterpret my data

item.text: Thinking about a recent time when you uploaded data to a repository or shared with another researcher, please answer the questions below.
What was your motivation for sharing your data? Please check all that apply.

answerOption.valueString: To advance science in a particular area
To collaborate with a researcher who requested the data
To comply with a requirement to share as a condition of my grant funding or employment

item.text: How much time did you or your staff spend preparing your data so it would be ready to share or upload?

answerOption.valueString: None, my data were already in a form that could be shared
None, my data were not in a form that another researcher would understand, but I made no changes

item.text: Did you provide any additional materials or information besides the dataset? Please check all that apply.

answerOption.valueString: Software or program required to access or analyze the data
Code used with the data, such as R code
Nothing, the data required no additional materials to be useful to the requester
Nothing, the data required additional materials to be useful to the requester, but I did not send them

item.text: If another researcher published or presented on results from your shared data, how were you acknowledged?

answerOption.valueString: Recognition in the acknowledgment section of the publication
No publication arose from sharing data
